posts.cooked:
Hello,

I just realised that if I swipe to archive a message it will also mark it as “read”, whereas archiving via long press menu doesn’t have that affect. I think the archiving behaviour should be consistent and I think it should not affect the unread/read status.

Especially with the new “pull to filter unread” feature it would be extremely helpful to archive unread message with a swipe and return to those later with “pull to filter unread”.

posts.name: AlertSubject
posts.cooked:
Ohh I never knew it’s not consistent, wow
I assumed it would always mark as read

Noticed this behavior when swiping left > archive on the iOS version of the app as well. Was quite displeased discovering that a conversation that I wanted to archive to get back to later (get it out of the main chat list so as not to accidentally tap/open/read it before I had the time to properly commit to it) was immediately marked read even if I did no such thing as reading the convo.

Archiving doesn’t mean reading and as such doesn’t warrant a change in read status.

Update:
Apparently this issue was alredy reported for Android way back when in ye olden age of yonder and subsequently closed as intentional behavior consistent across platforms, which went over “swimmingly” with the crowd. Because of course it doesn’t make sense.

It’s been reported for iOS recently again and has since received a PR so fingers crossed that this is fixed asap.

link_counts.title: Archiving an unread conversation on recipient side is marking it as read on the sender side · Issue #9147 · signalapp/Signal-Android · GitHub
Archiving Unread Messages marks them as read · Issue #5702 · signalapp/Signal-iOS · GitHub

posts.cooked:
This is apparently being worked on in the iOS version of the app:

github.com/signalapp/Signal-iOS

Archiving Unread Messages marks them as read

opened 12:53PM - 16 Nov 23 UTC
theschweitz

- [x] I have searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] I am submittin…g a bug report for existing functionality that does not work as intended ---------------------------------------- ### Bug description Archiving a conversation marks it as read ### Steps to reproduce - Have another signal user send you a message - Leave message unread and archive **Actual result:** Sender & Recipient will see their message check-boxes marked as Read **Expected result:** Unread messages should stay unread. This is not "consistent across platforms" as stated in https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/issues/9147. Telegram, for example, keeps unread messages as unread upon archiving. This is dangerous to users and Signal needs to prioritize this fix before this becomes a bigger issue than just inconvenience to users (see: the user mentioning a stalker in the comments of the above issue). Refusing to resolve this issue is irresponsible on Signal's part.

link_counts.title: Archiving Unread Messages marks them as read · Issue #5702 · signalapp/Signal-iOS · GitHub

posts.cooked: Great! Should I open an issue for the Android version then or can we assume they communicate between their teams…

There’s a topic for Android already but it’s simply been closed.

github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android

Archiving an unread conversation on recipient side is marking it as read on the sender side

opened 11:25PM - 30 Oct 19 UTC
closed 03:55AM - 19 Nov 19 UTC
itmaciek

- [x] I have searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] I am submitti…ng a bug report for existing functionality that does not work as intended - [x] I have read https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports - [x] This isn't a feature request or a discussion topic ---------------------------------------- ### Bug description If both contacts have read receipts enabled and one party is archiving messages without reading them, the other side sees it as read. ### Steps to reproduce Phone1: enable read receipts Phone2: enable read receipts Phone1: send a message to Phone2 Phone2: archive a conversation without reading it Phone1: message is visible for sender as read by the recipient (read receipts check marks) Phone2: undo archive Phone1: message is visible for sender as read by the recipient Phone2: message is visible as unread **Actual result:** message that was never read is visible for sender as read by the recipient **Expected result:** unread archived messages should not be visible as read for the sender ### Device info **Device:** Pixel 3 XL **Android version:** 9.0 **Signal version:** 4.49.13

As another poster in that thread said: “If a woman was in charge of this issue, the bug would not be closed “as designed”.” Couldn’t agree more.

posts.cooked: yeah that whole conversation reads… terrible. will just poke my nose in on the issue for iOS

Continuing the discussion from Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.23 release:

Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.23 release

, I know a lot of people that use swipe-to-archive, so it’s tricky to mess with that (not me, I basically never archive anything lol).

@greyson-signal sorry to hijack your comment from the beta thread, but this in my view explains why this feature request is misunderstood, because you literally never come across the inconsistency within the Android app. Could you, just for laughs, please compare the results between swiping to archive and archiving via the context-menu? All will become clear then.

I have been trying to find both actions in de code but since I am not an app developer I haven’t had much luck.
